intro: Oligactis asplundii, commonly known as the asplundii dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, spoon-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow composite flowers. The plant is native to southern Africa, particularly in regions of South Africa and Namibia. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry riverbeds. Oligactis asplundii is adapted to withstand drought conditions, with a deep root system that helps it survive in harsh, dry climates.
